The TathÄgata's heavenly eye is pure and subtle, seeing the birth and death, falling, and receiving good or evil forms of all sentient beings, and being born in good or evil existences. He can also clearly know the causes of all karmas.

He sees the birth and death of all beings, sees the formation and destruction of worlds, and also knows when beings give rise to the intention to achieve enlightenment and when they lose it. The TathÄgata, the World-Honored One, knows the exhaustion of all contaminations and is ultimately liberated. His rebirth is ended, the practice of purity is established, what was to be done is done, and there is no more future existence.

The TathÄgata, having accomplished this pure and complete knowledge of the destruction of contaminations, is able to expound it for sentient beings, causing those who hear it to sever all afflictions. Whether gods, humans, demons, Brahmas, ascetics, or brahmins, there is no one who can truthfully say that the TathÄgata does not understand or realize the Dharma.

Whether it is the Dharma of ordinary beings, the Dharma of sages, the Dharma of Å›rÄvakas, the Dharma of pratyekabuddhas, the Dharma of bodhisattvas, the Dharma of buddhas, the Dharma of learners, the Dharma of those beyond learning, the worldly Dharma, the supramundane Dharma, the wholesome Dharma, the unwholesome Dharma, the contaminated Dharma, the uncontaminated Dharma, the conditioned Dharma, or the unconditioned Dharma, the TathÄgata realizes and knows these dharmas equally, and is therefore called the Perfectly Enlightened One.

timely speech, true speech, real speech, correct speech, promised speech, meaningful speech, not excessive speech, speech in accordance with what is held, pure speech, speech that understands all languages, subtle speech, non-different speech, speech of a single sound. The unsurpassed honored one of great kindness and great compassion, endowed with such great relinquishment,
